text: Amazon quick site offers native
integration with Amazon data sources
such as redshift RDS and s3 in this
video let's take a look at how you can
create an analysis from data residing in
Amazon redshift we first go down the
part of the new analysis choosing to
create a new data set since we haven't
connected to this data source before we
pick a new data source here we are
presented with two options to connect to
a registered instance that is
auto-detected ie which is in the same
AWS account and in the same AWS region
or to manually connect to an instance of
your choosing
let's first pick the auto-detected
option
now before we are able to connect a
redshift we need to ensure that the
redshift cluster allows inbound
connections from the quick site IP
address to ensure connectivity you
should ensure that the cluster has the
publicly accessible flag set to yes and
also that IP ranges in the security
group configured correctly to ensure
secure access only to the connections
from the Amazon quick site service the
IPS to be whitelisted can be found in
the documentation and are different for
each region
setup you can then go ahead and connect
a quick site by simply providing the
username and password in the
auto-detected flow now instead if we
were to do this using the manual
connection option we would provide all
connection details just as you would
when connecting to this database from a
sequel tool including the fully
qualified DNS hostname this database has
been IP whitelisted so we are able to
connect to it and create a data set in
either direct query or spice mode will
opt to go through the direct query route
in this case and there you have it a
redshift data set ready to be explored
